title: Scatterplot: Older Sibling vs. Younger Sibling
question_text:
On the first day of school, $10$ randomly selected sibling combinations were asked how excited they were to come back to school. They were asked to rate their excitement on a scale from $1$ (very unhappy about coming back) to $10$ (very excited).
The scatterplot below displays their excitement levels, with the older siblings' ratings on the vertical axis and the younger siblings' ratings on the horizontal axis.
Albert.io. Copyright 2016

Which of the following is an accurate statement?

choices.text: For each sibling pair, the rating of the older sibling is equal to the rating of the younger sibling.
The range in the older siblings' ratings is less than the range of the younger siblings' ratings.
Younger siblings tended to be more excited about coming back to school than their older siblings.
The scatterplot displays a weak negative linear association between the younger siblings' ratings and the older siblings' ratings.

Fewer ratings of
8
or more were assigned to younger siblings than to older siblings.
